skill.name: pydicom
skill.description: Python library for working with DICOM (Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine) files. Use this skill when reading, writing, or modifying medical imaging data in DICOM format, extracting pixel data from medical images (CT, MRI, X-ray, ultrasound), anonymizing DICOM files, working with DICOM metadata and tags, converting DICOM images to other formats, handling compressed DICOM data, or processing medical imaging datasets. Applies to tasks involving medical image analysis, PACS systems, radiology workflows, and healthcare imaging applications.

security_audit.summary: Legitimate medical imaging skill with 3 Python scripts for DICOM processing. Scripts perform local file operations only - read user-specified DICOM files and write output files. No network calls, no credential access, no command execution. Standard filesystem access for file I/O is expected for this purpose.

content.user_title: Process DICOM files with pydicom workflows
content.value_statement: Medical imaging data requires careful handling to extract metadata, anonymize patient information, and convert files. This skill provides Python scripts and workflows for DICOM processing tasks.
actual_capabilities: Anonymize DICOM PHI tags and save a new file
Convert DICOM pixel data to PNG, JPEG, TIFF, or BMP
Extract DICOM metadata to text or JSON format
Apply VOI LUT windowing for image visualization
Handle multi-frame DICOM images and frame selection
limitations: Requires pydicom, numpy, and pillow Python packages
Does not anonymize UIDs unless explicitly enabled
Metadata export skips sequences unless requested
Compressed DICOM may need additional codec packages

use_cases.title: Anonymize study datasets
use_cases.description: Remove PHI fields and create shareable DICOM files for external analysis.

use_cases.title: Convert DICOM to images
use_cases.description: Export pixel data to PNG or JPEG formats for quality assurance dashboards.

use_cases.title: Audit metadata fields
use_cases.description: Inspect patient and study tags before approving data sharing.

prompt_templates.title: Extract metadata
prompt_templates.scenario: Need a quick metadata report for a DICOM file
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract metadata from my DICOM file and save it as text using the extract_metadata.py script. Use the default output format.

prompt_templates.title: Anonymize a study
prompt_templates.scenario: Prepare a DICOM file for external sharing
prompt_templates.prompt: Anonymize this DICOM file and replace PatientName and PatientID with ANONYMOUS using the anonymize_dicom.py script.

prompt_templates.title: Convert with windowing
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate a viewable PNG from a CT scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert a DICOM file to PNG and apply VOI LUT windowing using the dicom_to_image.py script. Report the image information.

prompt_templates.title: Handle multi-frame
prompt_templates.scenario: Export a specific frame from a multi-frame DICOM
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert frame 5 from a multi-frame DICOM to JPEG using dicom_to_image.py with the frame parameter set to 5.

output_examples.input: Anonymize this DICOM file and show what you changed.

best_practices: Verify anonymization results before sharing files with external parties
Check transfer syntax and install needed codec packages for compressed DICOM
Use VOI LUT windowing for accurate CT and MRI image visualization
anti_patterns: Sharing DICOM files without verifying PHI removal from all tags
Assuming all compressed images will decode without installing extra libraries
Overwriting original files without creating backups first

faq.question: Is this compatible with all DICOM files?
faq.answer: Standard uncompressed DICOM files work directly. Some compressed formats like JPEG 2000 require additional codec packages.

faq.question: What are the main limitations of the scripts?
faq.answer: Scripts do not validate DICOM conformance and UID anonymization must be enabled manually if needed.

faq.question: Can I integrate this in an automation pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, all scripts are command-line tools that can be called from shell scripts or workflow automation.

faq.question: How is data safety handled?
faq.answer: All processing is local on your machine. Anonymization removes common PHI tags from patient information.

faq.question: What should I do if conversion fails?
faq.answer: Install missing codec packages like pylibjpeg or python-gdcm and verify the transfer syntax before retrying.

faq.question: How does this compare to other DICOM tools?
faq.answer: Provides lightweight Python scripts focused on metadata extraction, anonymization, and image export tasks.
